faq.question: Why export Midjourney as PNG for upscaling?
faq.answer: PNG format provides the highest quality from Midjourney with no compression artifacts, giving our AI more detail to work with during upscaling.

faq.question: Should I use Midjourney's upscale first?
faq.answer: Yes! Always use Midjourney's built-in upscale (U1-U4) before exporting, then use our upscaler for additional enhancement to even higher resolutions.

faq.question: Will upscaling change my Midjourney style?
faq.answer: No, our upscaler is designed to preserve the original artistic style and aesthetic qualities of your Midjourney images while enhancing resolution.

faq.question: Can I upscale Midjourney grid images in PNG format?
faq.answer: For best results, first use Midjourney's upscale feature to get individual high-res images, then enhance them further with our upscaler.

faq.question: What resolution can I achieve from Midjourney PNGs?
faq.answer: Starting from Midjourney's PNG export (typically 1024x1024 or higher for v5), we can upscale up to 8x, achieving resolutions up to 8192x8192 pixels.

faq.question: Why use WebP for Midjourney images?
faq.answer: WebP provides better quality than JPEG at 30% smaller file sizes, making it perfect for web display of Midjourney art while maintaining fast page loads.

faq.question: Should I export from Midjourney as WebP directly?
faq.answer: Midjourney doesn't export directly to WebP. Export as PNG first (highest quality), then use our tool to upscale and convert to WebP simultaneously.

faq.question: Will WebP reduce my Midjourney image quality?
faq.answer: No! WebP actually provides better quality than JPEG at similar or smaller file sizes. Your Midjourney art will look excellent.

faq.question: Is WebP compatible with all platforms?
faq.answer: WebP is supported by all modern browsers (Chrome, Firefox, Safari 16+, Edge). For older browsers, provide JPEG fallbacks.

faq.question: Can I use WebP for print Midjourney images?
faq.answer: WebP is primarily a web format. For print, we recommend upscaling Midjourney PNGs or TIFFs. Use WebP for web display only.

faq.question: Should I export Midjourney as JPEG or PNG?
faq.answer: Always export Midjourney as PNG first for best quality. You can convert to JPEG after upscaling if needed. PNG provides lossless quality for our AI to work with.

faq.question: Can upscaling fix JPEG compression in Midjourney exports?
faq.answer: Yes! Our AI can significantly reduce JPEG compression artifacts while enhancing resolution, resulting in cleaner Midjourney images.

faq.question: Is JPEG or PNG better for sharing Midjourney art?
faq.answer: JPEG is more universally compatible for sharing, but PNG maintains maximum quality. Consider the platform requirements when choosing.

faq.question: Will my Midjourney JPEG look better after upscaling?
faq.answer: Yes! Our upscaler enhances resolution, reduces artifacts, and improves overall quality, making your Midjourney JPEGs look significantly better.

faq.question: Can I print upscaled Midjourney JPEGs?
faq.answer: Yes, but for best print results, consider upscaling the PNG export and converting to JPEG after, or using PNG/TIFF directly for print workflows.

faq.question: What resolution should I generate in Stable Diffusion?
faq.answer: For best upscaling results, use SDXL's native 1024x1024, or enable Hi-Res Fix in SD 1.5. Higher starting resolution yields better upscaled results.

faq.question: Can I upscale images from specific SD checkpoints?
faq.answer: Yes! Our upscaler works with images from any SD checkpoint or LoRA, preserving the unique style characteristics of each model while enhancing PNG quality.

faq.question: Does this work with SDXL PNG images?
faq.answer: Absolutely. SDXL's native 1024x1024 PNG resolution is a great starting point, and our upscaler can enhance it further to 4K and beyond while maintaining quality.

faq.question: Will upscaling add detail to my SD PNG images?
faq.answer: Our upscaler enhances existing details and sharpens the image, adding realistic textures during the upscaling process while preserving the original SD style.

faq.question: Can I upscale anime-style Stable Diffusion PNGs?
faq.answer: Yes, our upscaler works excellently with anime-style models and checkpoints, preserving line quality and cel-shading techniques while enhancing resolution.

faq.question: What's the best way to export DALL-E as PNG?
faq.answer: Download images directly from ChatGPT in PNG format when available. Avoid taking screenshots, as they reduce quality significantly.

faq.question: Can I upscale rectangular DALL-E PNG images?
faq.answer: Yes, we support both the classic square format and DALL-E 3's rectangular PNG outputs with proper aspect ratio maintenance.

faq.question: Will upscaling improve DALL-E text rendering in PNG?
faq.answer: Upscaling sharpens existing text in DALL-E PNG images, making it clearer, but won't fix spelling errors that were in the original generation.

faq.question: Can I print upscaled DALL-E PNG images?
faq.answer: Yes, 4K upscaled DALL-E PNGs are excellent for printing. We recommend testing a small print first to ensure quality meets your standards.

faq.question: Should I use DALL-E PNG or JPEG for upscaling?
faq.answer: Always prefer PNG format from DALL-E for best upscaling results. If you only have JPEG, our upscaler can still enhance it significantly while reducing artifacts.

faq.question: Can upscaling fix DALL-E JPEG compression?
faq.answer: Yes! Our AI reduces compression artifacts from ChatGPT JPEG downloads while enhancing resolution, resulting in cleaner DALL-E images.

faq.question: Is JPEG good enough for professional DALL-E use?
faq.answer: JPEG is sufficient for most sharing and web use. For professional printing, consider upscaling the PNG format instead.

faq.question: Will my DALL-E 3 JPEGs look better after upscaling?
faq.answer: Yes! Our upscaler enhances DALL-E 3 JPEGs while preserving the improved detail and texture rendering that makes DALL-E 3 special.

faq.question: Can I print upscaled DALL-E JPEGs?
faq.answer: JPEG can work for printing, but for best print results, consider upscaling DALL-E PNG exports and converting to JPEG after, or using PNG directly.

faq.question: Will text stay sharp when upscaling Canva PNGs?
faq.answer: Yes! Our upscaler is specifically optimized to maintain text clarity in Canva designs, keeping fonts crisp and readable at higher resolutions.

faq.question: Can I upscale Canva designs with embedded photos?
faq.answer: Yes, both the design elements and any embedded photos in Canva PNGs are enhanced. Complex designs with mixed content work well.

faq.question: Does this work with Canva Pro downloads?

faq.question: Can I upscale Canva designs for large format printing?
faq.answer: Yes! 4K-8K upscaled Canva PNGs work well for posters, banners, and other large format print applications.

faq.question: Why use WebP for Canva designs?
faq.answer: WebP provides better quality than JPEG at smaller file sizes, making it perfect for web display of Canva designs while maintaining fast page loads.

faq.question: Should I export Canva as WebP directly?
faq.answer: Canva doesn't export directly to WebP. Export as PNG first, then use our tool to upscale and convert to WebP simultaneously.

faq.question: Will WebP reduce my Canva design quality?
faq.answer: No! WebP provides equal or better quality than JPEG at smaller file sizes. Your Canva designs will look excellent in WebP format.

faq.question: Is WebP compatible with Canva Pro features?
faq.answer: Yes! WebP is compatible with all Canva design elements. After upscaling and conversion, you can re-import to Canva if needed.

faq.question: Can I use WebP for printed Canva designs?
faq.answer: WebP is primarily a web format. For printing Canva designs, consider using PNG or TIFF formats instead.

faq.question: Should I export Canva designs as JPEG or PNG?
faq.answer: Always export Canva designs as PNG first for best quality. You can convert to JPEG after upscaling if needed for sharing compatibility.

faq.question: Will text stay sharp in upscaled Canva JPEGs?
faq.answer: Yes! Our upscaler maintains text clarity in Canva designs, keeping fonts crisp and readable even when upscaling JPEGs.

faq.question: Can I upscale complex Canva designs with multiple elements?
faq.answer: Yes! Our upscaler handles complex Canva designs with multiple elements, text, and graphics while maintaining quality.

faq.question: Does this work with Canva Pro downloads?
faq.answer: Yes! Canva Pro's higher resolution starting point yields even better upscaled results when saved as PNG first.

faq.question: What's the best JPEG quality for exporting from Canva?
faq.answer: For upscaling, export as PNG and convert to JPEG after. If you must export as JPEG, use the highest quality setting available (usually quality slider at maximum).

faq.question: What's the best format to export from Photoshop for upscaling?
faq.answer: PNG (lossless) or TIFF are ideal for Photoshop upscaling. Avoid JPEG compression if you plan to upscale, as artifacts will be amplified.

faq.question: Can I upscale layered Photoshop PNG files?
faq.answer: Export flattened versions of each layer separately as PNGs, then upscale individually. Layers maintain their relationship after enhancement.

faq.question: Does this work with smart objects?
faq.answer: Yes, but ensure smart objects are rasterized at the highest resolution before upscaling for best results.

faq.question: Can I upscale 16-bit or 32-bit Photoshop PNGs?
faq.answer: Yes! Our upscaler supports high bit-depth Photoshop PNG exports, preserving tonal range and color accuracy.

faq.question: What about CMYK Photoshop images?
faq.answer: Yes, CMYK Photoshop PNGs for print can be upscaled. Color accuracy is preserved throughout the process.

faq.question: Why use WebP for Photoshop exports?
faq.answer: WebP provides better quality than JPEG at smaller file sizes, making it perfect for web display of Photoshop artwork while maintaining fast page loads.

faq.question: Should I export Photoshop as WebP directly?
faq.answer: Photoshop doesn't natively export to WebP. Export as PNG or TIFF first, then use our tool to upscale and convert to WebP.

faq.question: Will WebP reduce my Photoshop work quality?
faq.answer: No! WebP provides equal or better quality than JPEG at smaller file sizes. Your Photoshop work will look excellent in WebP format.

faq.question: Is WebP suitable for Photoshop print work?
faq.answer: WebP is primarily a web format. For print work, consider using PNG or TIFF formats instead.

faq.question: Does this work with Photoshop Generative Fill outputs?
faq.answer: Yes! Gen Fill outputs work great with our upscaler when converted to WebP format for web display.

faq.question: What's the best format to export from Photoshop for upscaling?
faq.answer: TIFF (uncompressed) or PNG are ideal for Photoshop upscaling. Export as these formats first, then convert to JPEG after upscaling if needed for sharing.

faq.question: Can I upscale layered Photoshop files as JPEG?
faq.answer: Export flattened versions of each layer separately as JPEGs, then upscale individually. Layer relationships can be maintained after enhancement.

faq.question: Does this work with Photoshop smart objects?
faq.answer: Yes, but rasterize smart objects at the highest resolution before upscaling JPEGs for best results.

faq.question: Can I upscale 16-bit Photoshop JPEGs?
faq.answer: Yes, our upscaler supports high bit-depth images from Photoshop. Note that JPEG will be saved as 8-bit, so convert after upscaling if 16-bit is needed.

faq.question: What about CMYK Photoshop images?
faq.answer: Yes, CMYK images can be upscaled. For print workflows, you may want to maintain CMYK throughout or convert to sRGB for web use.
